questions.question: This shade is ……………………….. than that shade?
questions.description: Use a comparative form before than.

questions.question: Have you got any shades ………………………… than this?
questions.description: Use a comparative form before than.

questions.question: I am the ……………………….. in my family.
questions.description: We use the superlative to compare one thing with the whole group to which it belongs.

questions.question: We must buy a ……………………….. car. This is not fast enough.
questions.description: Faster is the comparative form of fast.

questions.question: You are the ……………………….. person I have ever known.
questions.description: Funniest is the superlative form of funny.

questions.question: Can a cat be as ………………………… as a dog?
questions.description: We use the structure as…as… to say that two people or things are equal.

questions.question: She spoke ………………………… than her opponent in the debate.
questions.description: More confidently is the comparative form of confidently.

questions.question: We haven’t reached the station yet. We need to walk ……………………….
questions.description: When we are talking about physical distance farther and further are both possible.

questions.question: What is the ………………………. price you are willing to take?
questions.description: Least is the superlative form of little.

questions.question: Lead is ………………………… than any other metal.
questions.description: Heavier is the comparative form of heavy.

questions.question: If you had run ………………………… you could have caught him.
You are ……………………….. than anybody I know.
